citation.article-title: Desulfotomaculum halophilum sp. nov., a halophilic sulfate-reducing bacterium isolated from oil production facilities.

p.s: Description of Desulfotomaculum halophilum sp. nov.
Desulfotomaculum halophilum (ha.lo'phi.lum. Gr. n. halos salt; Gr. adj. philos loving; N.L. adj. halophilum salt-loving)
Straight to curved rod-shaped cells that are 0.5 μm wide and 3-6 μm long.
Motile by means of polar flagellum.
The pH range is 6.9-8.0; optimum growth occurs at pH 7.3.
The temperature range is 30-40°C; optimum growth occurs at 35°C.
The salinity range is 1-14%; optimum growth occurs at 4-6 %.
Reduces sulfate, sulfite and thiosulfate with production of sulfide.
Elemental sulfur, fumarate and nitrate are not used as electron acceptors.
H2, formate, lactate, pyruvate, malate, ethanol and n-butanol are oxidized.
Yeast extract is required as growth factor.
The G + C content of the DNA is 56.3 ±0.4 mol%.
The GenBank/EMBL accession number for the 16s rRNA sequence is US8891.
Habitat:production fluid from an oil-producing well in France.
The type strain is SEBR 3139 (= DSM 11559).
